channel.title: Jack Gilchrist
channel.description: Jack Gilchrist President of Gilchrist Metal Fabricating Co., Inc., Hudson, N.H. (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: I'm glad to have you as a champion of small business for New Hampshire.
item.author: Jack Gilchrist

item.title: Like many small businessmen, my dad borrowed against our house to purchase the machinery to start Gilchrist Metal Fabricating.
item.author: Jack Gilchrist

item.title: Machines making equipment for drilling oil, generating power, broadcasting television, processing food and many other industries.
item.author: Jack Gilchrist

item.title: We employ about 40 people, most of them with families, including my son Stuart.
item.author: Jack Gilchrist

item.title: Though we have enjoyed success, we face more global pressure every day. So do our suppliers and customers.
item.author: Jack Gilchrist

item.title: If we don't continually improve and streamline our processes to stay efficient, we will lose out to our competition.
item.author: Jack Gilchrist

item.title: We don't have a choice. Often the decisions we make are difficult. Running a business means taking responsibility:
item.author: Jack Gilchrist

item.title: Presenting a certain future to the management team. Developing a functional budget. Insuring that we have adequate supplies. Making a commitment to fulfill our customer's orders on time.
item.author: Jack Gilchrist

item.title: Sure, there are things which I cannot control. But running the business is my job and mine alone.
item.author: Jack Gilchrist

item.title: I blame no one else for the challenges we face.
item.author: Jack Gilchrist

item.title: I am often reminded of something Lee Iacocca said: "lead, follow or get out of the way."
item.author: Jack Gilchrist

item.title: Everyone who runs a business understands this. Everyone but our federal government. They won't lead. Their rules and regulations are too hard to follow. And they won't get out of our way.
item.author: Jack Gilchrist

item.title: This Administration is killing us out here. Small business needs a leader. A leader who understands the entire spectrum of business and industry.
item.author: Jack Gilchrist

item.title: A leader who can work with all parties involved. A leader who will not avoid dealing with difficult issues.
item.author: Jack Gilchrist

item.title: A leader with the experience to understand what it takes. A leader who is in touch with America's small businesses.
item.author: Jack Gilchrist

item.title: Mitt Romney is exactly that leader.
item.author: Jack Gilchrist
